articles.title: Bacolod City logs first mpox case
articles.description: A resident of Bacolod City in Negros Occidental has been infected with the mpox virus, the first recorded case here.
articles.content:
BACOLOD CITY, NEGROS OCCIDENTAL, Philippines — A resident of this city has been infected with the mpox virus, the first recorded case here.

articles.title: LPA, easterlies to bring cloudy skies, rains over some parts of PH
articles.description: The Low Pressure Area (LPA) was estimated over the coastal waters of Corcuera, Romblon and will bring cloudy skies with scattered rains and thunderstorms while the easterlies will be affecting the eastern section of the country on Tuesday, PAGASA reported.

articles.title: Kevin Durant Reportedly Has 'No Desire' to Play for Timberwolves amid NBA Trade Rumors
articles.description: Phoenix Suns star Kevin Durant isn't interested in the Minnesota Timberwolves as a future trade destination, according to ESPN's Shams Charania.
articles.content:
Phoenix Suns star Kevin Durant isn't interested in the Minnesota Timberwolves as a future trade destination, according to ESPN's Shams Charania.

articles.title: Unexplained Radio Pulses Detected in Antarctic
articles.description: A cosmic particle detector in the Antarctic recently found unexplained radio waves that seem to defy the very laws of physics.
articles.content:
Something strange is going on in the Antarctic. There, a cosmic particle detector recently found unexplained radio waves emanating from below the Earth’s surface. Not only was the finding unexpected, but it seemed to defy the very laws of physics.
Th... [1683 chars]

articles.title: Astronomers Measure Distribution of Ordinary Matter across Cosmic Web
articles.description: Astronomers have used Fast Radio Bursts (FRBs) to show that more than three-quarters of the Universe’s ordinary matter has been hiding in the thin gas between galaxies.
articles.content: Astronomers have used Fast Radio Bursts (FRBs) to show that more than three-quarters of the Universe’s ordinary matter has been hiding in the thin gas between galaxies, marking a major step forward in understanding how matter interacts and behaves in... [2989 chars]

articles.title: Former teacher who orally raped student struck off for minimum of 20 years by Teaching Council
articles.description: A former secondary school teacher who was convicted of the oral rape of one of his students over 30 years ago has been struck off from the register of teachers
articles.content:
A former secondary school teacher who was convicted of the oral rape of one of his students over 30 years ago has been struck off from the register of teachers.

articles.title: Alberta reports 53 more cases of measles, surpasses 900 total cases since March
articles.description: Data from the Alberta government's dashboard shows 53 more measles cases were confirmed over the weekend, bringing Alberta's total to 932.
articles.content:
Data from the Alberta government's dashboard shows 53 more cases were confirmed over the weekend, bringing Alberta's total to 932.
EDMONTON — Alberta has surpassed 900 cases of measles since the beginning of March.

articles.title: Man killed at 'No Kings' protest in Salt Lake City remembered as an acclaimed Polynesian designer
articles.description: Arthur Folasa Ah Loo was a former contestant on “Project Runway,” whose designs were beloved by celebrities from “Real Housewives” to “Moana” star Auli’i Cravahlo.

articles.title: Paul Reid expected to be named head of new planning body
articles.description: Former HSE boss Paul Reid is expected to be named as the chairperson of An Coimisiún Pleanála, which will replace An Bord Pleanála.
articles.content:
Former HSE boss Paul Reid is expected to be named as the chairperson of An Coimisiún Pleanála, which will replace An Bord Pleanála.

articles.title: At least 37 Palestinians killed in Gaza food site shooting, local authorities say
articles.description: Death toll is highest yet reported in near-daily shootings since US-backed group began distributing food in territory
articles.content:
At least 37 Palestinians were killed on Monday in new shootings in Gaza near food distribution centres run by private US contractors guarded by Israeli troops, local authorities said.
